summary.name: Vinyl Pressing Plants
summary.description: This is a **Facilities/Infrastructure Manifest** of vinyl pressing sites drawn from [published listings](https://vinyl-pressing-plants.com/). In addition to detailing the locations of these sites across different regions, each entry includes quantitative information about the production capabilities of a given site—the average lead time for production, the miniminum quantity required for an order, and the miminum and maximum gram weights of the vinyl platters the press is capable of producing. This demonstrates Manifest's capabilities for scaling its visualizations by quantitative variables. Scaling by minimum quantity, for example, allows a viewer to quickly identify plants that are more suitable for smaller productions.

overview.name: ResurRec
overview.description: ResurRec is a "full service modern and boutique vinyl pressing plant in Bangkok, Thailand" that handles "vinyl release[s] from start to retail" with "worldwide shipping available." The company, established in 2019, "is known for its merging of vinyl production with colorful modern designs, such as splatters or smoky effects, allowing customers to design unique, stylish, and timely vinyl." ResurRec has "produced over 200 titles, 80% of which are by Thai artists" and is "the first modern vinyl pressing plant in Southeast Asia." They have also "started getting clients from nearby countries like Hong Kong, Singapore, and Vietnam."

location.address: 15/117 Krung Thep Kritha Soi 37, Thap Chang, Saphan Sung, 10240, Bangkok, Thailand

overview.name: XDISC Vinyl Pressing Plant
overview.description: XDISC Vinyl Pressing Plant produces "all types of optical media: CD-R, CD, CD mini, DVD, Blu-Ray and vinyl records" and places "customers' music (as well as audiobooks and podcasts) on streaming services for paid listening or downloading." The Poland-based company was established in 2002 and employs over 250 specialists–"experts and music enthusiasts"–and has been "producing records for over 20 years" by combining "modern technologies with traditional processes, manufacturing records on both automatic and manual presses." In 2023, XDISC became a member of the Vinyl Alliance, "an association uniting the global community associated with the vinyl industry" and which "underscores [XDISC’s] commitment to the development of the vinyl record industry on a global scale."

overview.name: Vinil Brasil
overview.description: Vinil Brasil is a vinyl pressing plant based in São Paulo and founded in 2017 by poet, musician and composer Michel Nath. The company produces vinyl records for order through their website, email, and WhatsApp and has produced 65,000 records since its initial launch. The idea for Vinil Brasil began in 2014 when its founder "found the old presses of the Continental record label, one of the most important in the country between the 1940s and 1970s, in a junk iron in the city of São Paulo." "Brazil is one of the most musical countries in the world and São Paulo is our most musically diverse cityI didn’t like that my record had to be made abroad," Nath said. "We strive to make vinyl accessible to a wider spectrum of audience, thus generating a cultural legacy for Brazilian and Universal Music."

overview.name: Brooklynphono
overview.description: Brooklynphono is "a vinyl record pressing plant in NY with 5 printing presses that make 3,000 vinyl per day." Established in 2001 and based in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, the company "manufacture[s] 12" and 7" records offering black vinyl and custom color records" and offers custom packaging for records. "It caters mostly to indie-rock record labels based in Brooklyn, but also to several European dance record labels." "Inside the one-story, red-brick factory on 42nd Street, boxes of discarded albums from used-record stores are piled high on wooden pallets" and are recycled by the company, which "preserves a fading piece of history." They produce about 440,000 LPs a year.
